Unlinking All Tasks

In some cases, you may want to disconnect the StarTeam tasks from the Microsoft Project tasks. For example, you may have:

  • Forgotten to import StarTeam users before exporting tasks and encountered resource problems.

  • Rearranged your Microsoft Project (.mpp) file so that the Microsoft Project task order is no longer synchronized with the StarTeam task order.

  • Decided that you do not want to place your Microsoft Project tasks in StarTeam.

The process of disconnecting is referred to as “unlinking.” After the unlink operation, the icons for the tasks in StarTeam change. Tasks no longer have an icon with a checkerboard pad on a clipboard indicating that they were created in Microsoft Project. Instead, they have an icon with a lined pad on a clipboard indicating that they were created in StarTeam.

Unlinked tasks are no longer connected to Microsoft Project in any way. Like tasks created in StarTeam, you can delete, move, and share them.

To unlink the tasks in a Microsoft Project file:

  1. Select StarTeam > Unlink Tasks from the Microsoft Project menu bar. The StarTeam Task Integration dialog displays the following message: You will unlink all the tasks in the current project. Do you want to continue?

  2. Click Yes to unlink.
